title: Replays
body: In the new alpha client, you can choose to download replays and watch them later. Are these saved anywhere on your computer or do you need LoLReplay to get them off. If it's the latter, can you do it for games that have already finished?

replies.body:
Replays are saved in your *Match History*, which you can download for the last 20 matches, as *Lew* mentioned. You can only view a full game replay through the client, however, if you create a *Highlight* while you're viewing a replay, you can find the file in your (C:\Users\Example_Username\My Documents\League of Legends\Highlights) directory. The highlight will be saved **.webm** file and can be viewed in any *Chromium-based* web browser or most video players. I strongly recommend taking a look at our [**Replays FAQ**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/234965248-Replays-FAQ-Pro-Tips) for more information about this system.

Let me know if you're having any further issues with this.

The [replay ](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/234965248-Replays-FAQ-Pro-Tips)files are saved to your documents folder but I think the only way to view them currently is with the new client.  You also can't download past your most recent 20 games played.
